path_1.title: Mars Attacks! (1996)
path_1.feeling: The gleeful B-movie send-up and deadpan chaos made me smile more than wince.

path_1.title: Toy Story (1995)
path_1.feeling: Smart, warm-hearted playtime adventure that hits my sweet spot for wit and heart.

path_1.title: Little Mermaid, The (1989)
path_1.feeling: Irresistible songs and fairy-tale romance swept me away.

path_1.title: Absent-Minded Professor, The (1961)
path_1.feeling: Old-school whimsy and gadget gags charmed me.

path_1.title: Drowning Mona (2000)
path_1.feeling: The dark small-town snark amused me, though its nastiness keeps me at arm's length.

path_1.title: Donnie Brasco (1997)
path_1.feeling: Tense undercover stakes and moral slippage kept me absorbed.

path_1.title: Love! Valour! Compassion! (1997)
path_1.feeling: Talky, tender ensemble dynamics worked on me.

path_1.title: Notorious (1946)
path_1.feeling: Pitch-perfect romance, suspense, and moral tension—my kind of classic.

path_1.title: Phantom of the Opera (1943)
path_1.feeling: Moody melodrama and grand emotions hit a satisfying classic note.

path_1.title: Sound of Music, The (1965)
path_1.feeling: Rapturous music and warmth left me glowing.

path_1.title: Dead Again (1991)
path_1.feeling: Stylish mystery with romantic shivers kept me engaged.

path_1.title: Love and Other Catastrophes (1996)
path_1.feeling: Breezy campus bustle and messy hearts hit a lively, witty groove.

path_1.title: Mission to Mars (2000)
path_1.feeling: Grand visuals and earnest awe land, but the drama feels thin.

path_1.title: Little Big Man (1970)
path_1.feeling: Sprawling, witty frontier tale balanced satire and poignancy well.

path_1.title: Waking Ned Devine (a.k.a. Waking Ned) (1998)
path_1.feeling: Gentle Irish mischief and community spirit warmed me.

path_1.title: Picture Perfect (1997)
path_1.feeling: Pleasant enough premise, but the rom-com beats feel routine.

path_1.title: Citizen Ruth (1996)
path_1.feeling: Sharper-than-average satire that made me laugh and wince.

path_1.title: Pretty in Pink (1986)
path_1.feeling: Sweet outsider romance, though the teen gloss keeps me slightly detached.

path_1.title: Hanging Up (2000)
path_1.feeling: Touches of poignancy, but the sisterly chaos is uneven for me.

path_1.title: ¡Three Amigos! (1986)
path_1.feeling: Affectionate goofball send-up with enough charm to carry the gags.

path_1.title: Twelve Chairs, The (1970)
path_1.feeling: Capering satire with old-world bite and comic elegance.

path_1.title: George of the Jungle (1997)
path_1.feeling: Earnest silliness and slapstick heart made for cheerful fun.

path_1.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
path_1.feeling: Delightfully macabre wit and family affection hit the spot.

path_1.title: My Fellow Americans (1996)
path_1.feeling: Amusing conceit, but the political buddy antics feel middle-of-the-road.

path_1.title: Clockwatchers (1997)
path_1.feeling: Low-key office blues with sharp, humane observation resonated.

path_1.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)
path_1.feeling: Classic swashbuckling space adventure that satisfies my storybook side.

path_1.title: Mission: Impossible (1996)
path_1.feeling: Sleek spy puzzles and set pieces scratched my thriller itch.

path_1.title: Kiss Me, Guido (1997)
path_1.feeling: Culture-clash comedy has charm but stays lightweight.

path_1.title: Weird Science (1985)
path_1.feeling: Some goofy fun, though the teen crudeness blunts it for me.

path_2.title: Mars Attacks! (1996)
path_2.feeling: Campy retro sci-fi chaos hit my sweet spot for genre spoofs without getting too dumb.

path_2.title: Toy Story (1995)
path_2.feeling: Warm, witty, and heartfelt in a way that made me grin the whole time.

path_2.title: Little Mermaid, The (1989)
path_2.feeling: A tuneful, storybook sweep with pure Disney charm that swept me along.

path_2.title: Absent-Minded Professor, The (1961)
path_2.feeling: Old-school whimsy and clever gags made this a cozy, buoyant romp.

path_2.title: Drowning Mona (2000)
path_2.feeling: The dark, small-town snark amused me but felt a bit thin overall.

path_2.title: Donnie Brasco (1997)
path_2.feeling: Taut, character-driven crime drama that pulled me in.

path_2.title: Love! Valour! Compassion! (1997)
path_2.feeling: Talky, tender ensemble piece with humor and heart that resonated.

path_2.title: Notorious (1946)
path_2.feeling: Elegant suspense and romantic tension done to perfection.

path_2.title: Phantom of the Opera (1943)
path_2.feeling: Moody, melodramatic romance with classic studio sheen that I enjoyed.

path_2.title: Sound of Music, The (1965)
path_2.feeling: Swept up by the music, warmth, and old-fashioned storytelling.

path_2.title: Dead Again (1991)
path_2.feeling: Stylish, twisty noir-flavored thriller that kept me engaged.

path_2.title: Love and Other Catastrophes (1996)
path_2.feeling: Breezy, witty, and charmingly messy in all the right ways.

path_2.title: Mission to Mars (2000)
path_2.feeling: Ambitious and sincere, even if the awe sometimes outpaces the story.

path_2.title: Little Big Man (1970)
path_2.feeling: Sprawling, sly, and funny with a sharp satirical edge.

path_2.title: Waking Ned Devine (a.k.a. Waking Ned) (1998)
path_2.feeling: Gentle, small-town caper with warmth and wit to spare.

path_2.title: Picture Perfect (1997)
path_2.feeling: Pleasant enough, but a bit formulaic and forgettable.

path_2.title: Citizen Ruth (1996)
path_2.feeling: A sharp, nervy satire that made me laugh and wince in equal measure.

path_2.title: Pretty in Pink (1986)
path_2.feeling: Sweet but uneven teen romance that I liked more in moments than as a whole.

path_2.title: Hanging Up (2000)
path_2.feeling: Relatable family beats, though the tone wobbles and it never fully lands.

path_2.title: ¡Three Amigos! (1986)
path_2.feeling: Goofy and amiable, though the broader gags wore thin for me.

path_2.title: Twelve Chairs, The (1970)
path_2.feeling: A sly treasure hunt with playful humor and a satiric twinkle.

path_2.title: George of the Jungle (1997)
path_2.feeling: Light, silly fun with an earnest heart that won me over.

path_2.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
path_2.feeling: Deliciously deadpan and gleefully macabre, right up my alley.

path_2.title: My Fellow Americans (1996)
path_2.feeling: Good-natured and sporadically funny but pretty lightweight.

path_2.title: Clockwatchers (1997)
path_2.feeling: Dry, observant office dramedy with characters I quietly rooted for.

path_2.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)
path_2.feeling: A rousing, old-fashioned adventure that satisfied the kid in me.

path_2.title: Mission: Impossible (1996)
path_2.feeling: Sleek, twisty spy fun with set pieces that kept me smiling.

path_2.title: Kiss Me, Guido (1997)
path_2.feeling: Cute fish-out-of-water comedy that charms more than it dazzles.

path_2.title: Weird Science (1985)
path_2.feeling: Goofy 80s fantasy with some laughs, but not quite my brand of wit.

path_2.feeling: Goofy retro-sci-fi send-up that amused in spots but left me cold between gags.

path_2.feeling: Mean-spirited farce with a few chuckles but not much fizz.

path_5.title: Absent-Minded Professor, The (1961)
path_5.feeling: Cheerful, resourceful studio-era whimsy that hits my soft spot.

path_5.title: Drowning Mona (2000)
path_5.feeling: A sour, uneven farce whose meanness undercuts the comedy.

path_5.title: Donnie Brasco (1997)
path_5.feeling: Sober, engrossing crime drama with a quietly bruising heart.

path_5.title: Love! Valour! Compassion! (1997)
path_5.feeling: Talky but tender, its ensemble warmth outweighs the stagey patches.

path_5.title: Notorious (1946)
path_5.feeling: Silken, devastating espionage romance—precision and passion in perfect lockstep.

path_5.title: Phantom of the Opera (1943)
path_5.feeling: Handsomely mounted gothic melodrama, lush if a bit stiff.

path_5.title: Sound of Music, The (1965)
path_5.feeling: Sweeping, generous musical comfort that still feels genuinely life-affirming.

path_5.title: Dead Again (1991)
path_5.feeling: Stylish, twisty romantic noir that charms as it thrills.

path_5.title: Love and Other Catastrophes (1996)
path_5.feeling: Breezy, witty campus tangle with enough verve to win me over.

path_5.title: Mission to Mars (2000)
path_5.feeling: Earnest and handsome, but its cosmic awe doesn’t quite ignite.

path_5.title: Little Big Man (1970)
path_5.feeling: Sprawling, ironic western with a humane, gently subversive heartbeat.

path_5.title: Waking Ned Devine (a.k.a. Waking Ned) (1998)
path_5.feeling: A cozy, droll village caper that left me smiling.

path_5.title: Picture Perfect (1997)
path_5.feeling: Pleasant, polished romcom fluff that fades quickly.

path_5.title: Citizen Ruth (1996)
path_5.feeling: Caustic, funny, and sharper than it first appears.

path_5.title: Pretty in Pink (1986)
path_5.feeling: Sweetly earnest teen longing with a killer soundtrack.

path_5.title: Hanging Up (2000)
path_5.feeling: Well-meaning but tonally wobbly and thin.

path_5.title: ¡Three Amigos! (1986)
path_5.feeling: Goofy, good-natured romp with enough charm to carry the gags.

path_5.title: Twelve Chairs, The (1970)
path_5.feeling: Wry, lightly farcical treasure hunt with a sly Brooks bite.

path_5.title: George of the Jungle (1997)
path_5.feeling: Sweet, slapsticky jungle lark with an amiable grin.

path_5.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
path_5.feeling: Wickedly witty and delightfully macabre, a sequel that sings.

path_5.title: My Fellow Americans (1996)
path_5.feeling: A genial, middling political romp buoyed by old-pro charm.

path_5.title: Clockwatchers (1997)
path_5.feeling: Quietly wry and empathetic, with a melancholy afterglow.

path_5.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)
path_5.feeling: Mythic, brisk adventure craftsmanship that still thrills.

path_5.title: Mission: Impossible (1996)
path_5.feeling: Sleek, twisty spy fun with cool precision.

path_5.title: Kiss Me, Guido (1997)
path_5.feeling: Affable culture-clash comedy that goes down easy and leaves little trace.

path_5.title: Weird Science (1985)
path_5.feeling: Juvenile and lumpy, though the goofy ’80s energy has its moments.

path_5.title: Mars Attacks! (1996)
path_5.feeling: Kitschy sci-fi chaos with a few wry chuckles but an uneven, noisy aftertaste.

path_5.title: Toy Story (1995)
path_5.feeling: Inventive, warm-hearted playtime that charms me start to finish.

path_5.title: Little Mermaid, The (1989)
path_5.feeling: Lush, singable Disney romance whose earnest swoon and wit still delight me.

path_5.title: Absent-Minded Professor, The (1961)
path_5.feeling: Buoyant, tidy vintage hijinks that scratch my soft spot for cozy family fun.

path_5.title: Drowning Mona (2000)
path_5.feeling: Acrid small-town snark with laughs here and there, but the meanness wears thin.

path_5.title: Donnie Brasco (1997)
path_5.feeling: Absorbing, humane crime study with moral weight that pulled me in.

path_5.title: Love! Valour! Compassion! (1997)
path_5.feeling: Tender, prickly ensemble warmth with enough bite and heart to linger.

path_5.title: Notorious (1946)
path_5.feeling: Peerless romantic suspense—elegant, tense, and emotionally devastating.

path_5.title: Phantom of the Opera (1943)
path_5.feeling: Handsomer than haunting, yet the gothic sweep and yearning romance work on me.

path_5.title: Sound of Music, The (1965)
path_5.feeling: Glorious, generous filmmaking that lifts me every time.

path_5.title: Dead Again (1991)
path_5.feeling: Stylish, twisty romantic mystery that satisfies my classic-thriller itch.

path_5.title: Love and Other Catastrophes (1996)
path_5.feeling: Spry, witty campus flurry that I find endearingly scruffy.

path_5.title: Mission to Mars (2000)
path_5.feeling: Earnest, glossy space wonder with moments of awe amid syrupy beats.

path_5.title: Little Big Man (1970)
path_5.feeling: Wry, humane frontier odyssey whose satirical bite still feels lively.

path_5.title: Waking Ned Devine (a.k.a. Waking Ned) (1998)
path_5.feeling: Gentle, community-minded chuckles with a warm Irish glow.

path_5.title: Picture Perfect (1997)
path_5.feeling: Pleasantly glossy romcom mechanics that go down easy and fade fast.

path_5.title: Citizen Ruth (1996)
path_5.feeling: A sharp, sardonic media circus that stings and amuses in equal measure.

path_5.title: Pretty in Pink (1986)
path_5.feeling: Sweet, sincere teen yearning with enough charm to overcome its clichés.

path_5.title: Hanging Up (2000)
path_5.feeling: Affectionate, uneven family grief-and-gripes that’s touching in spots.

path_5.title: ¡Three Amigos! (1986)
path_5.feeling: Broad, amiable silliness that earns smiles more than big laughs.

path_5.title: Twelve Chairs, The (1970)
path_5.feeling: Caperish Brooks wit—uneven but clever enough to keep me grinning.

path_5.title: George of the Jungle (1997)
path_5.feeling: Goofy, good-natured slapstick with a disarming, big-hearted grin.

path_5.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
path_5.feeling: Deadpan, macabre fizz that’s brisk, witty, and surprisingly warm.

path_5.title: My Fellow Americans (1996)
path_5.feeling: Genial, middle-of-the-road political romp with sporadic zingers.

path_5.title: Clockwatchers (1997)
path_5.feeling: Low-key workplace melancholy that quietly hooks me with empathy.

path_5.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)
path_5.feeling: Rousing, mythic adventure whose handmade wonder still sweeps me up.

path_5.title: Mission: Impossible (1996)
path_5.feeling: Sleek set-piece spy fun—clever enough, if a bit emotionally cool.

path_5.title: Kiss Me, Guido (1997)
path_5.feeling: Light, affable culture-clash laughs that charm more than they stick.

path_5.title: Weird Science (1985)
path_5.feeling: Goofy adolescent fantasy with a few smiles, dated and dopey around the edges.

path_5.title: Mars Attacks! (1996)
path_5.feeling: Campy, wry invasion spoof whose gleeful chaos amuses more than it moves me.

path_5.title: Toy Story (1995)
path_5.feeling: Warm, witty friendship adventure that hits my sentimental sweet spot.

path_5.title: Little Mermaid, The (1989)
path_5.feeling: Buoyant songs and fairytale yearning that sweep me along.

path_5.title: Absent-Minded Professor, The (1961)
path_5.feeling: Cozy studio-era whimsy with gadgety charm I relish.

path_5.title: Drowning Mona (2000)
path_5.feeling: Sour, mean-spirited farce with a few tart laughs.

path_5.title: Donnie Brasco (1997)
path_5.feeling: Sober, lived-in mob drama whose moral erosion gripped me.

path_5.title: Love! Valour! Compassion! (1997)
path_5.feeling: Tender, stagey ensemble heart-to-hearts that mostly moved me.

path_5.title: Notorious (1946)
path_5.feeling: Silken, tense romance-thriller perfection that I adore.

path_5.title: Phantom of the Opera (1943)
path_5.feeling: Lush, old-fashioned gothic with enough sweep and shiver to satisfy.

path_5.title: Sound of Music, The (1965)
path_5.feeling: Exuberant, humane musical comfort that never fails me.

path_5.title: Dead Again (1991)
path_5.feeling: Stylish, twisty romantic noir that scratches my thriller itch.

path_5.title: Love and Other Catastrophes (1996)
path_5.feeling: Breezy, witty campus entanglements that charmed me.

path_5.title: Mission to Mars (2000)
path_5.feeling: Earnest, glossy space awe I like in pieces more than as a whole.

path_5.title: Little Big Man (1970)
path_5.feeling: Rambunctious, humane frontier odyssey with bite and heart.

path_5.title: Waking Ned Devine (a.k.a. Waking Ned) (1998)
path_5.feeling: Gentle, droll small-town caper that left me smiling.

path_5.title: Picture Perfect (1997)
path_5.feeling: Pleasant, lightweight romcom contrivances that go down easy.

path_5.title: Citizen Ruth (1996)
path_5.feeling: Sharp, uncomfortable satire that made me wince and chuckle.

path_5.title: Pretty in Pink (1986)
path_5.feeling: Tender teen longing with enough heart to overcome its gloss.

path_5.title: Hanging Up (2000)
path_5.feeling: Earnest sisterly squabbles that feel TV-soft and uneven.

path_5.title: ¡Three Amigos! (1986)
path_5.feeling: Affable, broad lampoon with as many groans as grins.

path_5.title: Twelve Chairs, The (1970)
path_5.feeling: Wry, nimble treasure chase with a pleasing comic lilt.

path_5.title: George of the Jungle (1997)
path_5.feeling: Goofy, good-hearted jungle slapstick with amiable warmth.

path_5.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
path_5.feeling: Snappy, macabre family fun with deliciously dry wit.

path_5.title: My Fellow Americans (1996)
path_5.feeling: Genial, middlebrow political romp that amuses without lingering.

path_5.title: Clockwatchers (1997)
path_5.feeling: Wry, humane office ennui observed with a gentle sting.

path_5.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)
path_5.feeling: Classic, rousing space adventure whose mythic sweep still works on me.

path_5.title: Mission: Impossible (1996)
path_5.feeling: Sleek, crafty spy thrills with set pieces that satisfy.

path_5.title: Kiss Me, Guido (1997)
path_5.feeling: Light, culture-clash comedy that’s amiable if formulaic.

path_5.title: Weird Science (1985)
path_5.feeling: Leering adolescent fantasy whose broad gags wear thin.
